Package me.bristermitten.mittenlib.lang.format

Class AbstractMessageFormatter

java.lang.Object
me.bristermitten.mittenlib.lang.format.AbstractMessageFormatter
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageFormatter
Direct Known Subclasses:
MiniMessageFormatter, SimpleMessageFormatter
public abstract class AbstractMessageFormatter extends Object implements MessageFormatter
An abstract implementation of MessageFormatter that provides a default implementation of preFormat(String, OfflinePlayer). This implementation keeps a set of FormattingHooks, and calls them sequentially. This implementation does not implement MessageFormatter.format(String, OfflinePlayer), leaving the Component creation to the subclasses.

  • Method Details

    • preFormat

      @NotNull public @NotNull String preFormat(@NotNull @NotNull String message, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
      Description copied from interface: MessageFormatter
      Apply all FormattingHooks to a String, returning the formatted String. This method is handy when Components cannot be used but may leave the String not completely formatted, for example preserving legacy formatting codes (&c)
      Specified by:
      preFormat in interface MessageFormatter
      Parameters:
      message - the message to format
      player - the player to format for. This can be used for player-specific formatting, such as PlaceholderAPI
      Returns:
      the formatted String
